results.title: Reflections: Ireland
results.creator_credit: Patrick Carey, John Spencer, Grania O'Shannon and Viscom Productions
results.brief_description: This beautiful atmospheric film shows various aspects of an Irish landscape, which is particularly emphasised by rivers, wind and sea. Interesting use of sounds, eg birds chirping, water flowing and the use of traditional Irish folk music played by Paddy Moloney and the Chieftains.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Patrick Carey, John Spencer, Grania O’Shannon and Viscom Productions

results.title: Inja = Dog
results.creator_credit: Joe Weatherstone, Steve Pasvolsky and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
South Africa, 1980s. Using a young Xhosa boy as a pawn, a farmer teaches his puppy to be white man’s best friend. Ten years later, both their lives hang in the balance at the mercy of the dog.
Filmed on location at Bien Donne Werf, Franschhoek Valley, South Africa.
In English/Afrikaans/Xhosa with English subtitles

results.title: Relax it's just sex [DVD]
results.creator_credit: P.J. Castellaneta, Harold Warren, Megan O'Neill, Steven J Wolfe, Sneak Preview Entertainment, Forefront Films and Millivres Multimedia
results.brief_description: Relax its just sex is about a group of twenty/thirty-something friends - a mix of straight, lesbian, bi-sexual and homosexual - sorting through the complexities of their relationships with various lovers and friends. Tara (Jennifer Tilly) is the mother hen of the group who keeps them all together; Vincey is the only single one and longs for a partner; Sarina and Megan break up when Megan sleeps with a man; Robin is their friend who helps Sarina out. On the whole the film has a comic tone - the opening sequence cautions the audience that when it comes to homosexuality there is nothing to be afraid of. Nevertheless, the film soon turns tragic as it delves into issues such as AIDS and gay bashing. Characters frequently address the camera, explaining their inner thoughts and feelings about their current situation as well as musing on the nature of love and sex. With at least ten principal characters, some are not given enough screen time to develop beyond caricature and at times the film is stagnated by its talkiness. Despite these flaws however, “Relax its just sex” is by turns amusing, thought provoking and quite sexy.
results.creator_credit_for_label: P.J. Castellaneta, Harold Warren, Megan O’Neill, Steven J Wolfe, Sneak Preview Entertainment, Forefront Films and Millivres Multimedia

results.title: Relationships and stress
results.creator_credit: David A. Tapper, Time-Life Video & Television and Tapper Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Coping with Serious Illness”.
One part of a series of six programs which looks at the major problems faced by Joan Robinson, who is dying of cancer. This episode shows ways of handling the changing relationships with family, friends and medical personnel. Experts talk to the viewer about how serious illness can materially change relationships and how people can cope with the emotions and strains that inevitably follow diagnosis of a serious illness. Narrated by Meryl Streep.

results.title: Doctors and patients
results.creator_credit: David A. Tapper and Time-Life Video
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Coping with Serious Illness”.
This film is one of a series of six programs that address the major problems people face in coping with serious illness. The series is hosted by actress, Meryl Streep. This particular program examines the unique relationship that develops between a doctor and a dying patient and looks at the case of Joan Robinson, a woman dying of cancer. Cast also includes Meryl Streep.

Cast also includes Meryl Streep.

results.title: The Laundry
results.creator_credit: Lesley Dyer, Alex Chomicz and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
A big man covered in blood enters a basement laundry. Is the threat in her mind or it real? And which is more scary…?
Cast features Rhonnda Findleton and Domenic Galati.

results.title: Pain (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: David A. Tapper and Time-Life Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Coping with Serious Illness”.
Meryl Streep hosts this film discussing with experts in the field of managing pain. Joan Robinson suffers from cancer. She has lived with unremitting chronic pain for months and years along with her husband Eric which clouded their work and personal lives. Joan and her doctors explored many kinds of medication with mixed results - sometimes they would work, others not so.
